20110127190007.000|20110127190009.000|TR0|CHRISTINE ROMANS, CNN ANCHOR:  All right, 
20110127190009.000|20110127190011.000|TR0|it's two minutes to the top of the hour in 
20110127190011.000|20110127190014.000|TR0|the East.  And the hour's top story is 
20110127190014.000|20110127190016.000|TR0|this, 57 years after racially segregated 
20110127190016.000|20110127190019.000|TR0|schools were declared unconstitutional, a 
20110127190019.000|20110127190021.000|TR0|public high school in Pennsylvania is 
20110127190021.000|20110127190024.000|TR0|segregating some of its homerooms by race.
20110127190024.000|20110127190026.000|TR0|
20110127190026.000|20110127190029.000|TR0|The school is McCaskey East in Lancaster, 
20110127190029.000|20110127190031.000|TR0|midway between Philadelphia and 
20110127190031.000|20110127190033.000|TR0|Harrisburg.  Faced with a stubborn racial 
20110127190033.000|20110127190036.000|TR0|achievement gap, an African-American 
20110127190036.000|20110127190038.000|TR0|teacher went to the principal with a 
20110127190038.000|20110127190041.000|TR0|thought about mentoring.  What if young 
20110127190041.000|20110127190043.000|TR0|black men had homeroom with black male 
20110127190043.000|20110127190046.000|TR0|teachers and young black women were paired 
20110127190046.000|20110127190048.000|TR0|with black female teachers? And what if 
20110127190048.000|20110127190051.000|TR0|homeroom were more than simply attendance 
20110127190051.000|20110127190053.000|TR0|taking and routine announcements?
20110127190053.000|20110127190056.000|TR0|
20110127190056.000|20110127190058.000|TR0|Principal Bill Jimenez agreed to try it.  
20110127190058.000|20110127190100.000|TR0|"Let's look at the data," he said, 
20110127190100.000|20110127190103.000|TR0|"referring to standardized test scores as 
20110127190103.000|20110127190105.000|TR0|well as some research on same-race 
20110127190105.000|20110127190108.000|TR0|classes.  Let's not run from it but 
20110127190108.000|20110127190110.000|TR0|confront it and see what we can do about 
20110127190110.000|20110127190113.000|TR0|it."
20110127190113.000|20110127190115.000|TR0|
20110127190115.000|20110127190118.000|TR0|So now, for six minutes every morning and 
20110127190118.000|20110127190120.000|TR0|20 minutes once a week, the junior class 
20110127190120.000|20110127190123.000|TR0|in McCaskey East splits by race and sex, 
20110127190123.000|20110127190125.000|TR0|and in just a few minutes, we're going to 
20110127190125.000|20110127190127.000|TR0|hear how it's working out.

20110127191051.000|20110127191054.000|TR0|ROMANS:  We began the hour with a story 
20110127191054.000|20110127191056.000|TR0|that sounds at best like a throwback to 
20110127191056.000|20110127191059.000|TR0|the bad old days, students at a public 
20110127191059.000|20110127191101.000|TR0|high school separated by race.  But what's 
20110127191101.000|20110127191104.000|TR0|happening at McCaskey East in the 
20110127191104.000|20110127191106.000|TR0|Lancaster, Pennsylvania, it's far from 
20110127191106.000|20110127191108.000|TR0|black and white.
20110127191108.000|20110127191111.000|TR0|
20110127191111.000|20110127191113.000|TR0|It's a mentoring program conceived by an 
20110127191113.000|20110127191116.000|TR0|African-American teacher designed to close 
20110127191116.000|20110127191118.000|TR0|an achievement gap that was painfully 
20110127191118.000|20110127191121.000|TR0|clear in last year's standardized testing. 
20110127191121.000|20110127191123.000|TR0| Sixty percent of the school's white 
20110127191123.000|20110127191126.000|TR0|students scored proficient or advanced in 
20110127191126.000|20110127191128.000|TR0|reading, barely a third of its black 
20110127191128.000|20110127191131.000|TR0|students did.  Even fewer black students 
20110127191131.000|20110127191133.000|TR0|aced math.
20110127191133.000|20110127191135.000|TR0|
20110127191135.000|20110127191138.000|TR0|So, now, for a six-minute daily homeroom 
20110127191138.000|20110127191140.000|TR0|and 20-minute session once a week, the 
20110127191140.000|20110127191143.000|TR0|junior class at McCaskey splits by race 
20110127191143.000|20110127191145.000|TR0|and sex and talks about the future.
20110127191145.000|20110127191148.000|TR0|
20110127191148.000|20110127191150.000|TR0|(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)
20110127191150.000|20110127191153.000|TR0|
20110127191153.000|20110127191155.000|TR0|ANGELA TILGHMAN, MCCASKEY EAST HIGH SCHOOL

20110127191158.000|20110127191200.000|TR0|research that focused on 
20110127191200.000|20110127191202.000|TR0|African-Americans, what was best for their 
20110127191202.000|20110127191205.000|TR0|academic needs.  And one thing that some 
20110127191205.000|20110127191207.000|TR0|of the study said from Maryland was 
20110127191207.000|20110127191210.000|TR0|mentoring.       So we were already 
20110127191210.000|20110127191212.000|TR0|running with that idea.  And they actually 
20110127191212.000|20110127191215.000|TR0|emphasize same gender mentoring.  So I

20110127191331.000|20110127191333.000|TR0|ROMANS:  We invited school officials to

20110127191336.000|20110127191338.000|TR0|want to talk about the challenges that

20110127191340.000|20110127191343.000|TR0|ways they're trying to meet them with Sam

20110127191345.000|20110127191348.000|TR0|author of the upcoming book "Faces of 
20110127191348.000|20110127191350.000|TR0|Learning: 50 Powerful Stories of Defining 
20110127191350.000|20110127191353.000|TR0|Moments in Education."
20110127191353.000|20110127191355.000|TR0|
20110127191355.000|20110127191358.000|TR0|Sam, does the McCaskey homeroom experience 
20110127191358.000|20110127191400.000|TR0|-- is this a defining moment for this 
20110127191400.000|20110127191403.000|TR0|school?
20110127191403.000|20110127191405.000|TR0|
20110127191405.000|20110127191407.000|TR0|SAM CHALTAIN, AUTHOR, "FACES OF LEARNING": 
20110127191407.000|20110127191410.000|TR0| It's definitely a defining moment for the 
20110127191410.000|20110127191412.000|TR0|community because of the media firestorm 
20110127191412.000|20110127191415.000|TR0|that's erupted around it.  And I think it 
20110127191415.000|20110127191417.000|TR0|actually provides a great opportunity for 
20110127191417.000|20110127191420.000|TR0|the community going forward.  But I would 
20110127191420.000|20110127191422.000|TR0|say, I think it's a really 
20110127191422.000|20110127191425.000|TR0|well-intentioned and, nonetheless, 
20110127191425.000|20110127191427.000|TR0|misguided experiment.
20110127191427.000|20110127191430.000|TR0|
20110127191430.000|20110127191432.000|TR0|ROMANS:  Why it misguided?
20110127191432.000|20110127191434.000|TR0|
20110127191434.000|20110127191437.000|TR0|CHALTAIN:  Well, first, it's clear that 
20110127191437.000|20110127191439.000|TR0|the adults that came up with this idea are 
20110127191439.000|20110127191442.000|TR0|sincere in their willingness to do 
20110127191442.000|20110127191444.000|TR0|whatever it takes to improve student 
20110127191444.000|20110127191447.000|TR0|learning conditions and learning outcomes, 
20110127191447.000|20110127191449.000|TR0|as they should be.  All of us that are in 
20110127191449.000|20110127191452.000|TR0|education, all of us that are parents, all 
20110127191452.000|20110127191454.000|TR0|of us that are members of this society 
20110127191454.000|20110127191456.000|TR0|should be committed to doing whatever we 
20110127191456.000|20110127191459.000|TR0|can to improve learning conditions for 
20110127191459.000|20110127191501.000|TR0|kids.
20110127191501.000|20110127191504.000|TR0|
20110127191504.000|20110127191506.000|TR0|But I think there's a distinction about 
20110127191506.000|20110127191509.000|TR0|what's the goal and what's our evidence.  
20110127191509.000|20110127191511.000|TR0|In the bit that you just ran, there's 
20110127191511.000|20110127191514.000|TR0|references to some research studies and 
20110127191514.000|20110127191516.000|TR0|the need to improve academic goals and 
20110127191516.000|20110127191519.000|TR0|reduce the achievement gap.  But one of 
20110127191519.000|20110127191521.000|TR0|the things that I've seen across the 
20110127191521.000|20110127191523.000|TR0|country and that really concerns me is, 
20110127191523.000|20110127191526.000|TR0|when we talk about reducing the 
20110127191526.000|20110127191528.000|TR0|achievement gap, do we mean merely 
20110127191528.000|20110127191531.000|TR0|reducing the discrepancy between test 
20110127191531.000|20110127191533.000|TR0|scores of white students and students of 
20110127191533.000|20110127191536.000|TR0|color, or do we mean reducing the 
20110127191536.000|20110127191538.000|TR0|predictive impact that can things like 
20110127191538.000|20110127191541.000|TR0|race, class and gender have on all aspects 
20110127191541.000|20110127191543.000|TR0|of student engagement, performance and 
20110127191543.000|20110127191546.000|TR0|learning?
20110127191546.000|20110127191548.000|TR0|
20110127191548.000|20110127191550.000|TR0|If the former, then perhaps it does make 
20110127191550.000|20110127191553.000|TR0|sense to try to do a piecemeal solution 
20110127191553.000|20110127191555.000|TR0|that can only impact one particular area 
20110127191555.000|20110127191558.000|TR0|of a student's experience.  But if the 
20110127191558.000|20110127191600.000|TR0|alternative is true, that we recognize 
20110127191600.000|20110127191603.000|TR0|that students don't just bring an academic 
20110127191603.000|20110127191605.000|TR0|motivation to school, they bring social, 
20110127191605.000|20110127191608.000|TR0|emotional needs, they bring the hopes and 
20110127191608.000|20110127191610.000|TR0|aspirations of their communities, they 
20110127191610.000|20110127191612.000|TR0|bring in lots of different cultural and 
20110127191612.000|20110127191615.000|TR0|socioeconomic influences, and so if we're 
20110127191615.000|20110127191617.000|TR0|trying to impact all of that, then surely 
20110127191617.000|20110127191620.000|TR0|six minutes a day, 20 minutes 
20110127191620.000|20110127191622.000|TR0|periodically, and perhaps the unintended 
20110127191622.000|20110127191625.000|TR0|consequences of only isolating black boys 
20110127191625.000|20110127191627.000|TR0|and girls, and not applying the same 
20110127191627.000|20110127191630.000|TR0|strategy to all of the other students, the 
20110127191630.000|20110127191632.000|TR0|reason that everybody's paying so much 
20110127191632.000|20110127191635.000|TR0|attention to it is there is no more raw 
20110127191635.000|20110127191637.000|TR0|nerves in American history than race-based 
20110127191637.000|20110127191639.000|TR0|issues and racial segregation.
20110127191639.000|20110127191642.000|TR0|
20110127191642.000|20110127191644.000|TR0|So I think there was not perhaps a clear 
20110127191644.000|20110127191647.000|TR0|enough attention being paid to the ways in 
20110127191647.000|20110127191649.000|TR0|which some of those unintended 
20110127191649.000|20110127191652.000|TR0|consequences might play out with a 
20110127191652.000|20110127191654.000|TR0|decision like this.
20110127191654.000|20110127191657.000|TR0|
20110127191657.000|20110127191659.000|TR0|ROMANS:  Well, there's the raw nerve of 
20110127191659.000|20110127191702.000|TR0|racial segregation in America.  You know, 
20110127191702.000|20110127191704.000|TR0|three decades on, this is still something 
20110127191704.000|20110127191706.000|TR0|that just hurts.  And then there's also 
20110127191706.000|20110127191709.000|TR0|this need on a school district by school 
20110127191709.000|20110127191711.000|TR0|district -- school-by-school basis to 
20110127191711.000|20110127191714.000|TR0|figure out why you have achievement gaps 
20110127191714.000|20110127191716.000|TR0|and to fix them.
20110127191716.000|20110127191719.000|TR0|
20110127191719.000|20110127191721.000|TR0|Now, they talking about race-based 
20110127191721.000|20110127191724.000|TR0|mentoring, that it works. What do the 
20110127191724.000|20110127191726.000|TR0|studies say?  I mean, does it work to

20110127191728.000|20110127191731.000|TR0|frankly, gender, and try to teach them in 
20110127191731.000|20110127191733.000|TR0|their peer groups?  Does that work?
20110127191733.000|20110127191736.000|TR0|
20110127191736.000|20110127191738.000|TR0|CHALTAIN:  Well, no doubt, mentoring is an 
20110127191738.000|20110127191741.000|TR0|essential part of any healthy learning 
20110127191741.000|20110127191743.000|TR0|environment.  Actually, the book of mine 
20110127191743.000|20110127191746.000|TR0|that's just coming out that you 
20110127191746.000|20110127191748.000|TR0|referenced, it's 50 stories from people 
20110127191748.000|20110127191751.000|TR0|across the country from the secretary of 
20110127191751.000|20110127191753.000|TR0|education, to students, to social workers, 
20110127191753.000|20110127191755.000|TR0|all being asked to reflect on their own 
20110127191755.000|20110127191758.000|TR0|most powerful learning experience.
20110127191758.000|20110127191800.000|TR0|
20110127191800.000|20110127191803.000|TR0|And the reason I bring it up here is the 
20110127191803.000|20110127191805.000|TR0|purpose of the effort was to try to reveal 
20110127191805.000|20110127191808.000|TR0|to all of us, what do we already know from 
20110127191808.000|20110127191810.000|TR0|lived experience about what powerful 
20110127191810.000|20110127191813.000|TR0|learning environments look like?  And what 
20110127191813.000|20110127191815.000|TR0|that book reveals is that the essential 
20110127191815.000|20110127191818.000|TR0|conditions of a powerful learning 
20110127191818.000|20110127191820.000|TR0|environment are that it must be 
20110127191820.000|20110127191822.000|TR0|challenging, engaging, relevant, 
20110127191822.000|20110127191825.000|TR0|supportive, and experiential.
20110127191825.000|20110127191827.000|TR0|
20110127191827.000|20110127191830.000|TR0|So the emphasis here on trying to provide 
20110127191830.000|20110127191832.000|TR0|more mentoring opportunities for kids is 
20110127191832.000|20110127191835.000|TR0|exactly right.  But the inattention being 
20110127191835.000|20110127191837.000|TR0|paid on the likelihood that only 
20110127191837.000|20110127191840.000|TR0|segregating black students, and only for a 
20110127191840.000|20110127191842.000|TR0|limited amount of time, might impact the 
20110127191842.000|20110127191844.000|TR0|other aspects in which this environment is 
20110127191844.000|20110127191847.000|TR0|supportive and nurturing and engaging.  I 
20110127191847.000|20110127191849.000|TR0|think that's why, ultimately, it's a 
20110127191849.000|20110127191852.000|TR0|misguided strategy.
20110127191852.000|20110127191854.000|TR0|
20110127191854.000|20110127191857.000|TR0|ROMANS:  So, the teachers, should they be 
20110127191857.000|20110127191859.000|TR0|allowed to continue it and see what 
20110127191859.000|20110127191902.000|TR0|happens and what kind of results?  I mean, 
20110127191902.000|20110127191904.000|TR0|the anecdotal results, a couple of the 
20110127191904.000|20110127191907.000|TR0|teachers said from the very beginning, is 
20110127191907.000|20110127191909.000|TR0|that this is working well on the boys.  
20110127191909.000|20110127191911.000|TR0|That the boys are sitting up a little

20110127191929.000|20110127191931.000|TR0|just other boys, they're able to talk 
20110127191931.000|20110127191934.000|TR0|about things that they maybe wouldn't talk 
20110127191934.000|20110127191936.000|TR0|about in front of the girls or some of the 
20110127191936.000|20110127191938.000|TR0|other students.  If they find that this is 
20110127191938.000|20110127191941.000|TR0|working with these kids, do you still say 
20110127191941.000|20110127191943.000|TR0|it's misguided and they shouldn't do it 
20110127191943.000|20110127191946.000|TR0|anymore?
20110127191946.000|20110127191948.000|TR0|
20110127191948.000|20110127191951.000|TR0|CHALTAIN:  Well, yes.  Let me offer the 
20110127191951.000|20110127191953.000|TR0|caveat, that the people that are in that 
20110127191953.000|20110127191956.000|TR0|school and are participating in this 
20110127191956.000|20110127191958.000|TR0|project certainly know far more about 
20110127191958.000|20110127192000.000|TR0|what's working and what isn't working than 
20110127192000.000|20110127192003.000|TR0|I or that anybody else does.
20110127192003.000|20110127192005.000|TR0|
20110127192005.000|20110127192008.000|TR0|I would say it's not surprising that if 
20110127192008.000|20110127192010.000|TR0|time has been carved out of the schedule 
20110127192010.000|20110127192013.000|TR0|for any group of students to have more 
20110127192013.000|20110127192015.000|TR0|direct and supportive interactions with an 
20110127192015.000|20110127192018.000|TR0|adult to find ways to connect to ideas 
20110127192018.000|20110127192020.000|TR0|from history, people from history that are 
20110127192020.000|20110127192023.000|TR0|meaningful to them, and that help inspire 
20110127192023.000|20110127192025.000|TR0|them to do better, obviously that makes 
20110127192025.000|20110127192027.000|TR0|sense.  What I would urge any school to do 
20110127192027.000|20110127192030.000|TR0|is think about, how can we provide those 
20110127192030.000|20110127192032.000|TR0|kinds of conditions for all students so 
20110127192032.000|20110127192035.000|TR0|that in the spirit of trying to help, 
20110127192035.000|20110127192037.000|TR0|perhaps some of the students that are most 
20110127192037.000|20110127192040.000|TR0|at risk were conscious of creating a 
20110127192040.000|20110127192042.000|TR0|school environment that is modeled on the 
20110127192042.000|20110127192045.000|TR0|basic ideas of our democracy, which is 
20110127192045.000|20110127192047.000|TR0|that we are committed to equity, to 
20110127192047.000|20110127192050.000|TR0|equality, and to making sure that all 
20110127192050.000|20110127192052.000|TR0|people have an equal opportunity and 
20110127192052.000|20110127192054.000|TR0|aren't singled out in ways that might make 
20110127192054.000|20110127192057.000|TR0|them feel more self-conscious than they 
20110127192057.000|20110127192059.000|TR0|would otherwise?

20110127192112.000|20110127192114.000|TR0|
20110127192114.000|20110127192117.000|TR0|CHALTAIN:  All right.  Thanks, Christine.
20110127192117.000|20110127192119.000|TR0|
20110127192119.000|20110127192121.000|TR0|ROMANS:  The concept of all-black 
20110127192121.000|20110127192124.000|TR0|homerooms has been a hot topic online 
20110127192124.000|20110127192126.000|TR0|today.  Here's some of the comments you 
20110127192126.000|20110127192129.000|TR0|left on CNN.com and on Facebook.
20110127192129.000|20110127192131.000|TR0|
20110127192131.000|20110127192134.000|TR0|Vincent posted this comment: "As an 
20110127192134.000|20110127192136.000|TR0|African-American lawyer and parent, I 
20110127192136.000|20110127192139.000|TR0|deplore any type of racial separation, 
20110127192139.000|20110127192141.000|TR0|especially racial segregation in 
20110127192141.000|20110127192143.000|TR0|education.  Deliberate 
20110127192143.000|20110127192146.000|TR0|government-sanctioned racial segregation 
20110127192146.000|20110127192148.000|TR0|in schools cannot be condoned regardless 
20110127192148.000|20110127192151.000|TR0|of the intentions.  Supplemental classes 
20110127192151.000|20110127192153.000|TR0|and programs in mentoring should be based 
20110127192153.000|20110127192156.000|TR0|on need and not on race."
20110127192156.000|20110127192158.000|TR0|
20110127192158.000|20110127192201.000|TR0|Clint posted this on Facebook: "It sounds 
20110127192201.000|20110127192203.000|TR0|like a useful program, and that the 
20110127192203.000|20110127192206.000|TR0|students have some great mentors.  I'm not 
20110127192206.000|20110127192208.000|TR0|convinced that separating the black 
20110127192208.000|20110127192210.000|TR0|students from everyone else is necessary.  
20110127192210.000|20110127192213.000|TR0|That being said, at least the school is 
20110127192213.000|20110127192215.000|TR0|attempting to do something."
20110127192215.000|20110127192218.000|TR0|
20110127192218.000|20110127192220.000|TR0|Stephanie says, "As an African-American 
20110127192220.000|20110127192223.000|TR0|educator, I understand the importance of 
20110127192223.000|20110127192225.000|TR0|students having role models, but this can 
20110127192225.000|20110127192228.000|TR0|be done after school.  I applaud the 
20110127192228.000|20110127192230.000|TR0|effort, but it bothers me if it's not

20110127192233.000|20110127192235.000|TR0|struggling."       And Joanna says, "I

20110127192242.000|20110127192245.000|TR0|maybe a little different from them."

20110127192433.000|20110127192435.000|TR0|(voice-over):  Santa Fe is one of the 
20110127192435.000|20110127192438.000|TR0|oldest settlements in all of the West, and 
20110127192438.000|20110127192440.000|TR0|it draws thousands of older tourists

20110127192442.000|20110127192445.000|TR0|good for some businesses, but not so much 
20110127192445.000|20110127192447.000|TR0|for some young professionals.

20110127192455.000|20110127192457.000|TR0|probably, you know, every summer I see 
20110127192457.000|20110127192500.000|TR0|around a dozen friends move on for jobs or

20110127192502.000|20110127192505.000|TR0|exciting places like New York or Portland, 
20110127192505.000|20110127192507.000|TR0|Oregon, or places like that.
20110127192507.000|20110127192509.000|TR0|
20110127192509.000|20110127192512.000|TR0|FOREMAN:  And that's where MIX comes in.  
20110127192512.000|20110127192514.000|TR0|These are the founding members, and this 
20110127192514.000|20110127192517.000|TR0|is MIX, part freeform social club, part

20110127192519.000|20110127192522.000|TR0|meeting.  MIX is a once-a-month party in 
20110127192522.000|20110127192524.000|TR0|which young people are urged to meet, have 
20110127192524.000|20110127192527.000|TR0|fun, and share ideas about what they want

20110127193223.000|20110127193226.000|TR0|ROMANS:  Just tuning in, here's what 
20110127193226.000|20110127193228.000|TR0|you've missed.  A Pennsylvania public 
20110127193228.000|20110127193231.000|TR0|school is segregating some of its 
20110127193231.000|20110127193233.000|TR0|homerooms by race.  At McCaskey East in 
20110127193233.000|20110127193236.000|TR0|Lancaster, Pennsylvania, an African- 
20110127193236.000|20110127193238.000|TR0|American teacher came up with the idea of 
20110127193238.000|20110127193241.000|TR0|a mentoring program.  For six minutes 
20110127193241.000|20110127193243.000|TR0|every morning and 20 minutes once a week, 
20110127193243.000|20110127193245.000|TR0|the junior class at McCaskey East splits 
20110127193245.000|20110127193248.000|TR0|by race and sex.  It was designed to close 
20110127193248.000|20110127193250.000|TR0|an achievement gap after last year's 
20110127193250.000|20110127193253.000|TR0|standardized testing showed 60 percent of 
20110127193253.000|20110127193255.000|TR0|the school's white students scored 
20110127193255.000|20110127193258.000|TR0|proficient or advanced in reading, while 
20110127193258.000|20110127193300.000|TR0|barely a third of its black students did.  
20110127193300.000|20110127193303.000|TR0|Even fewer black students aced math.
20110127193303.000|20110127193305.000|TR0|
20110127193305.000|20110127193308.000|TR0|Homeland security secretary Janet 
20110127193308.000|20110127193310.000|TR0|Napolitano just announced the U.S. is 
20110127193310.000|20110127193312.000|TR0|getting is rid of the now-familiar color 
20110127193312.000|20110127193315.000|TR0|coded terror alert system that's been in 
20110127193315.000|20110127193317.000|TR0|place since after September 11.  Instead, 
20110127193317.000|20110127193320.000|TR0|Homeland Security will use a detailed 
20110127193320.000|20110127193322.000|TR0|advisory to advise us about specific 
20110127193322.000|20110127193325.000|TR0|threats.  The new system will include
